meanings.definition: Attracting attention by being bright, showy, or ostentatious.
meanings.sent1: The flashier car had shiny rims that caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was much flashier than mine with all its sparkles and sequins.
meanings.sent3: The peacock thought his feathers couldn't get any flashier until he found a disco ball.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night were even flashier than a fireworks display.
meanings.sent5: The magician's cape was so flashier that it seemed to glow on its own.

meanings.definition: Showy in a way that is meant to impress or attract attention.
meanings.sent1: The flashier jewelry in the store window sparkled under the lights.
meanings.sent2: The mansion on the hill was much flashier than the modest houses in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The peacock's dance became even flashier when he added a top hat and cane.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and flashier as a neon sign.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks show was so flashier that it outshone the full moon.
